page.title: 17LOCAL TRANSPORT.
page.content: As this is a rural area,the use of a car is both convenient and essential. A service bus runs one day each week to{YORK,}returning after three hours, stopping at{LANGTON}and{KENNYTHORPE en route.During the week a local coach company picks up passengers at most of the villages,between school runs. People wishing to go to{MALTON }or {YORK}at any other time would have to take a taxi. Walking or cycling to {MALTON}means negotiating a long hill. During hard winters most roads leading towards{MALTON}and{YORK}get blocked by snow,leaving the villages cut off. The{SCARBOROUGH}to{YORK}railway line runs along the edge of{LOW HUTTON although it no longers stops there.The old station house has been sold and is now a private house. The {RIVER DERWENT}has no traffic except for the occassional canoe.
